ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 289
ygData.msgSnippet: Yup, they definitely can t make it a high HP pet.  I just want a pet to show off my tinkering skill and to goof off with.  It would provide a great money sink
ygData.messageBody:
Yup, they definitely can't make it a high HP pet. I just want a pet to show
off my tinkering skill and to goof off with. It would provide a great money
sink which Verant seems to love, as well. I don't even care if it will
fight anything. A pet that follows me like a shadow or at most even looks
for food and that's it is good enough for me. Some people had some great
suggestions on different kinds of pets and the various pricing. Good work.
I'll keep my fingers crossed and hope my warrior gets to tinker a playmate
someday.

Kilkin Cobblepot
46 Gemchopper - Fen Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: Cory Burns [mailto:coryb@...]
Sent: Friday, June 23, 2000 9:16 AM
To: EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 289


What about a wizard class. Which all in all would be the strongest class
with even a crappy little pet. A wizards biggest problem is keeping the mob
occupied while he/she cast a spell. Think about it even if the pet had 200
HP it would take a giant 2 hits to kill it giving the casting times on
wizard spells. He could get his root off and then proceed to whip up the
giant I am not saying he would still win, but a class that is strong like
wizards that do not use pets and would really damn strong if they did, would
be something Verant would not ever do.



Fanrick Tinker/Magician of Tarew Marr
